japanese: 警官に名前を聞かれた。
english: A police officer asked me for my name.

japanese: 「それ誰？」「子供の頃のトムだよ」「同じ頃のメアリーの写真もある？」
english: "Who's that?" "That's Tom when he was a kid." "Do you have a similar picture of Mary?"

japanese: もう遅いから、静かにしてください。
english: Please be quiet. It's late already.

japanese: 生意気な小僧がよ。
english: Cheeky little boy!

japanese: 目玉焼きが朝の定番。
english: Fried eggs are a morning staple.

japanese: 最寄駅で降ろしてくださる？
english: Would you kindly let me off at the nearest station?

japanese: 毎晩寝る前に本を読みます。
english: I read a book every night before bed.

japanese: プレイヤーとしてはかなり優秀。
english: He's quite the outstanding player.

japanese: たくさん農薬使ってそうでこわい。
english: I'm afraid of heavy pesticide use.

japanese: 自分より犬の方が良い肉食べてる。
english: My dog eats better meat than I do.

japanese: 新たな逮捕者が出て注目が集まってる。
english: The new arrests are drawing attention.

japanese: 買う前は悩んだけど使ってみたら大満足。
english: I was worried before buying it, but once I tried using it I was extremely satisfied.

japanese: 新人なのに察しが良くて、みんな助かってる。
english: Even though he's a newcomer, his judgement is good and he helps everyone out.

japanese: チマチマやるより一気にやったほうが効率いい。
english: It's more efficient to do it all at once than to do it bit by bit.

japanese: ブラウザのバージョンが上がると少しうれしい。
english: It's kind of nice to see my browser get updated.

japanese: いくら検索しても、目当ての情報は見つからない。
english: No matter how much I search, I can't find the information I'm looking for.

japanese: 自販機の周りにペットボトルがたくさん捨てられてる。
english: There's a lot of plastic bottles littered around vending machines.

japanese: 私はいつだってあなたに頼ってきた。でも、それももう終わり。
english: I've always depended on you. But that's over now.

japanese: 新聞は本より安い。
english: The newspaper costs less than the book.

japanese: 「チョリソーってなに？」「一種の肉だね。辛いソーセージだよ」
english: "What's chorizo?" "It's a type of meat. It's like a spicy sausage."

japanese: 安くなるのを待たずさっさと買う方がいい。
english: It's better not to wait for it to get cheaper and buy it quickly.

japanese: 親切なんだか押しつけがましいんだかわからん。
english: I can't tell if it's being kind or pushy.

japanese: どうせたいしたことない割引だろう。
english: I don't think it'll be much of a discount anyhow.

japanese: 詐欺にあったのではと思うほど届くのが遅い。
english: It took so long to get delivered, I thought I might've been scammed.

japanese: 技術はすごいのに見せ方がまずい。
english: The technique is great, but the way it is presented is not good.

japanese: ツッコミどころ多すぎてとまどう。
english: There are so many things that are off with that that I don't even know which to point out first.

japanese: お前だけじゃ心配だろう？
english: Aren't you worried about being alone?

japanese: スナック菓子をつまんだら全部食べてしまう。
english: If I even just start to snack, I end up eating it all.

japanese: このアルバム、すべての曲が良すぎて最高。
english: All of the tracks on this album are so good, it's the best.

japanese: それが第一印象です。
english: That is a first impression.

japanese: 重宝してるわ。
english: Oh, it's useful.

japanese: タバコは体に良くないから、やめた方がいいよ。
english: Smoking is bad for your health, you should quit.

japanese: 電車オタクなんです。
english: I'm a train nerd, you see.

japanese: 食べっぷりがいいね？
english: The way you eat is good.

japanese: フロントガラスがカチカチだった。
english: There was ice on my windshield.

japanese: トムの弱虫！
english: Tom, you wimp!

japanese: この取り組みについては後年、評価されるだろう。
english: This initiative will be evaluated in the future.

japanese: 図書館、人が多かった？
english: Were there many people in the library?

japanese: 「パソコンの電源、落としとく？」「そのままにしといて。まだ使ってるんだ」
english: "Want me to turn off the computer?" "Leave it on. I'm still using it."

japanese: スイスは鉄道大国です。
english: Switzerland is the land of the railway.

japanese: もう引っ越しました。 今、自分は一人で住んでいます。
english: I've moved out already. Now I live alone.

japanese: ロナルド・マクドナルドは私の大親友です。
english: Ronald McDonald is my best friend.

japanese: ぼくしゃん、あかしゃん。
english: I'm baby.

japanese: わたち、あかちゃん。
english: I'm baby.

japanese: あった方が良いけどなくても別に大丈夫だよ。
english: If you had some, that'd be great, but it's fine if you don't.

japanese: ここは座っとくには寒すぎるから、中で食べようよ。
english: It's too cold for me to sit out here. Let's eat inside.

japanese: 寒くてここには座っとけないから、うちで食べましょう。
english: It's too cold for me to sit out here. Let's eat inside.

japanese: 明日の朝は、何時出発？
english: What time will we leave tomorrow morning?

japanese: ドアを開けて中に入ってみた。
english: I opened the door and went inside.

japanese: 冷蔵庫には何が入ってるの？
english: What have you got in your fridge?

japanese: 歩いてもたったの5分よ。
english: It's only a five-minute walk.

japanese: 歩いても5分しかかからないわ。
english: It's only a five-minute walk.

japanese: 違う学校に通う弟は、先週から始めたよ。
english: My younger brother, who goes to a different school, started last week.

japanese: うるうるしちゃう。
english: I will cry.

japanese: うるうるしそう。
english: They are tearing up.

japanese: 前例があるのに放置していたのならなお悪い。
english: Despite the precedent, it would have been worse to leave it alone.

japanese: いつもこの自販機でお気に入りのコーヒーを買う。
english: I always buy my favorite coffee at this vending machine.

japanese: 違和感あったけど足になじんで今じゃ快適。
english: They felt uncomfortable at first, but now they fit my feet well and are comfortable.
